_header: Saint Patrick came through Gods grace to preach in Ireland
Subjects: saints’ lives; Patrick, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Patrick (with his Purgatory) in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn patric com þoru godes grace to preci in irlondeTo teche
                    men hor riȝte bileue on Ihesu to vnderstonde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Beteþ alle ȝoure sunne her as god wole ȝou grace
                    sendeþat we wiþþoute oþer pyne to parais henne
                    wende
BodAsh43.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden.
         Paderborn: F. Schoningh, 1875: 151-210.

Bod779.First Lines:
Seyn pateryk com þoru godes grace to preche In irelondeto
                    teche men here ryȝte be leue Ihesu cryst to vnderstonde…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…Now god lete vs so oure synne bete for his holy woundeSo
                    þat we In purgatorye by leue lyte stounde

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seint Patrik com þorwh God to preche in IrelondeTo teche
                    þe rihte bi leeue of Ihesu crist to vndurstonde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…God lete vs her vr sunnes beete for his holy woundeSo
                    þat we in Purgatorie bi leuen a luytel stounde. A.M.E.N.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint paterik þoru godes grace makede ane put of
                    IrlondeÞat seint Patrike purgatorie is icleoped ȝeot ase ich
                    onderstonde…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…God leue us ovre sunnes here so biete for is holie
                    woundeÞat we ne þoruen in purgatorie bi leue bote luyte
                    stounde
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden.
         Paderborn: F. Schoningh, 1875: 177-211.
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 199-220.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Patrik com þorw godes grace To preche in yrlondTo preche
                    hem right bileue Ihesu Crist to vnderstonde…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Now god let vs so oure sinne bete for is holi woundeSo
                    þat we may in purgatorie bileue bot a stounde
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint Patrik cam þour goddis grace to prechen in þe
                    londTo teche men here riȝte bi leue of ihesu crist to
                    vndirstond…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…God lete vs so oure synnes to bete for his holi woundeSo
                    þat we in purgatory duelle but litil stounde

OxfCCC431.First Lines:
[S]eint patryk com þurȝ godes grace to preche in irlondTo
                    teche men hore riȝte bileue & of god vnderstond…
OxfCCC431.Last Lines:
…Now god lete vs oure sunnes bete for his holy woundeSo
                    þat we in purgatorie leue lute stounde
OxfCCC431.Note: Portion of text lost due to mutilation of leaves.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayne Patrike come þurgh goddeȝ grace to preche in
                    irlandeAnd teche men þe right trouthe of criste til vndrestandeSo
                    ful of vermynne was þat men myȝt vnnes gangeÞat had sone
                    harme with venyme or with tange…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…loude þai sange þe letany & haly watre [ ]
                    plente& praide til al þe halelis þat þat his h[ ]de
                    be
CULAdd3039.Note: Ends imperfectly due to loss of folios at end of volume.

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seint Patrik com þoru godes grace to prechi in irlondeTo teche
                    men hore riȝte bileue of ihesu crist to vnderstonde…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Nou god lete us so oure sunne bete for his holi wondeSo
                    þat we in purcatorie bileue lute stounde
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.85-110.

CamFitzMc128.First Lines:
…Cold it was and foul it stank him thoȝt that it him
                    sloghOn that oþer half a wynd ther blew his flesh him thoȝt to
                    rend…
CamFitzMc128.Last Lines:
…This kniȝt stod and beheld about & his ryȝt state
                    vnderstodeAnd rehetid of that liȝt amendid him flesch &
                    blode…
CamFitzMc128.Note: Begins and ends imperfectly due to loss of folios.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Patrik com þorw gode grace to prechi in IrlondeTo teche
                    men þe riYte by [ ] of Ihesu crist to vnderstonde…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now god lete vs oure sunnes here bete ffor his woundes
                    ffyueÞat we in purgatorie by leue lutel stounde after þis
                    wrecchede lyue

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint patryk come þorw godes grace [ ] þer be eirlondTo
                    teche men here riȝt byleue of ihesu crist to vnderstond…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Now god lete ous so oure synnes bete for his holy
                    woundeþat we in pyne of purhatorie byleue lytel stounde

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
SEin patric com þoru godes grace to prechi in yrlondeto teche
                    men hor riȝte by leue of ihesu crist to vnder stonde…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Nou god let vs so oure sinne bete for is holy wondeSo
                    þat we in purgatorie by leue lute stonde
BLAdd10301.Attributed Title:
De sancto patricio (f. 41, by scribe in margin beside first line);
                        patricius (RT)

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint patric com þorou godes grace to prechi in yrlondto teche men ȝhare riȝt bileue of ihesu crist to onþerstonde…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …beteþ all ȝoure sinne her as god wole ȝou grace sendeþat ȝe with oute oþer pine to paradis henne wende
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xxi” added to right margin by later hand (f. 36).

Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seint patrik com þorw god to prechi in YrlondeTo teche þe riȝte bileue of ihesu to vnderstonde…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …God vs lete oure sunnes bete vor is holi woundeSo þat we in purgatorie bi leue lutel stounde

Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden.

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEynt Patric com þorȝ godis grace to prechi in yrlondeTo teche ȝem þe Riȝte bileue of ihesu crist vndirstonde…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Nou god let ous so oure sinnys bete vor is vine wondeÞat we in purgatorie bi leue lute stounde

BLEge2891.First Lines: [   ]in Patrik com þoru godes grace to prechi in irlonde[    ]teche men here riȝte bileue of ihesu crist to vnder stonde…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …Nou god lete us oure sunne bete for is holy wondeSo þat we in pulcatorie byleue lyte stounde
BLEge2891.Note: Beginnings of lines on f. 24v lost because outer margin torn away.
BLEge2891.Attributed Title: De sancto Patricio (rubric in margin, f. 24v)

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Patrik þurȝ goddes grace in irlond made a
                    pitteÞat saynt Patrikes purgatorye ȝett men callen
                    hit…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…God graunte vs to bete oure synnes here for his holy
                    woundeÞat we in peyne of Purgatorye lenge but a litel
                    stounde

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seint Patrik come þorgh goddis grace to prech in yrelondTo
                    tech men her riȝt byleue of god to vnderstonde…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…And þonked our swete lord ful fast boþ nyght &
                    dayAnd siþ on his bare flessh þe holy cros he
                    nome…
TokyoTak54.Note:
Imperfect; ends at D’Evelyn  and  Mill (1959)
